intro: Zygogynum pancheri subsp. deplanchei, commonly known as the Deplanche's zygogynum, is a rare and less-studied plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in lowland forests. Due to habitat loss and limited research, its conservation status remains uncertain.
